content:
You're thinking strategically about your content! I think it's a great idea to start with a kitchen tour or a meal prep planning session. Here's why:

**Kitchen Tour**:

* A kitchen tour can be a great way to introduce your audience to your cooking space and show them where the magic happens.
* It can also help establish your credibility and expertise as a cook and meal prep enthusiast.
* You can point out your favorite kitchen tools, gadgets, and appliances, and share why you love them.
* A kitchen tour can be a more relaxed and conversational format, which can help your audience get to know you better.

**Meal Prep Planning Session**:

* A meal prep planning session can be a great way to showcase your process and provide valuable information to your audience.
* You can walk your audience through how you plan your meals for the week, including how you decide on recipes, make a grocery list, and shop for ingredients.
* This can be a very informative and engaging format, as your audience will be able to see how you think and plan your meals.
* You can also share tips and tricks for meal planning, such as how to save time, reduce food waste, and stay organized.

**Why not start with a meal prep cooking session?**

* While a meal prep cooking session can be a great way to showcase your cooking skills and provide a recipe, it may not be the best starting point for your meal prep content.
* A cooking session may not provide as much context or background information about your meal prep process, which can make it harder for your audience to follow along.
* By starting with a kitchen tour or meal prep planning session, you can provide more context and background information, which can make your cooking session more informative and engaging.

So, I think starting with a kitchen tour or meal prep planning session is a great way to introduce your meal prep content and provide value to your audience. Once you've established your process and provided context, you can move on to more cooking-focused content.
